intro: Cussambium pubescens, commonly known as the hairy cussambium, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Cussambium pubescens is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in humid climates.
